availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Jerry Trigg (Barren County slave of Alanson Trigg)

body.p: Warren County, Kentucky, farmer. Barren County, Kentucky, native. Married to Civety A. Trigg. Enslaved by Alanson Trigg in Barren County and Warren County in 1862.

bibl.p: Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, Bristow, p. 9A. Wright, Julia Francis Trigg Death Certificate, Bowling Green, Warren County, Kentucky, 5 June 1933, State File # 15193, Film # 7019178. Kentucky. Vital Statistics Original Death Certificates â€“ Microfilm (1911-1964). Microfilm rolls #7016130-7041803. Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives, Frankfort, Kentucky.
